author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump says that the government would retain guarantees and an oversight role over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac even as he pursues a public offering for the mortgage giants.
title: Trump Says Fannie Mae to Keep US Guarantee as Public Firm

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump said Canada would need to pay $61 billion to join the “Golden Dome” system he’s proposed to boost missile defense with space-based interceptors.
title: Trump Says Golden Dome Missile System to Cost Canada $61 Billion

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK government said it would cut back planning hurdles faced by smaller housebuilders, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer seeks to deliver on his target of building 1.5 million new homes.
title: UK to Cut Planning Hurdles for Small Builders in Housing Push

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump is granting pardons to reality television stars Todd and Julie Chrisley, who were convicted of fraud and tax evasion, the latest offer of clemency to prominent figures accused of white-collar crimes.
title: Trump to Pardon Stars of Reality Show ‘Chrisley Knows Best’

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s less than one-year-old government faces its biggest test yet, with feuding between the two biggest coalition parties threatening the national budget.
title: Thaksin-Backed Coalition Risks Fracturing in Thai Budget Vote

author: Molly Smith
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy editor Molly Smith looks at what’s behind the jump in consumer confidence. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Tariff Truce Boosts Consumer Confidence, at Least For Now

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth imposed a new round of restrictions on news outlets that cover the Pentagon, declaring large portions of the building off-limits to reporters unless they have an escort.
title: Hegseth Imposes Fresh Limits on Reporter Access to the Pentagon

author: Greg Stohr
description: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court to block a judge’s order that requires the government to give people notice and an opportunity to object before they are deported to a so-called third country.
title: Trump’s DHS Asks Supreme Court to Intervene in Deportation Case

author: Joao Lima
description: Portugal said TAP SA is more important for the country’s strategy than as a financial issue, as the government continues planning the privatization of the state-owned airline.
title: Portugal Says Carrier TAP Is Strategic as It Plans Privatization

author: Oscar Medina
description: China could step in to finance infrastructure in Colombia and across Latin America if the US fulfills its threat to block funding, according to Beijing’s ambassador to Bogota.
title: China Offers to Fund Colombia Projects If the US Blocks Loans

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu has requested approval from lawmakers to raise almost $24 billion for an external borrowing plan over the next two years to boost economic growth.
title: Nigeria’s Tinubu Seeks Approval to Raise $24 Billion in Foreign Loans

author: Nicola M White, Lydia Beyoud, Bill Allison
description: Brian Quintenz, the crypto lobbyist President Donald Trump nominated to serve as chair of the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission, disclosed assets worth at least $3.4 million and positions in key industry groups.
title: Trump’s CFTC Pick Discloses $3.4 Million in Assets, Crypto Ties

author: Ryan Chua
description: The US and its allies across the Atlantic must forge a technology partnership and win the artificial intelligence race even as China makes steady advances, the UK’s envoy in Washington said.
title: UK Envoy Urges Transatlantic Tech Alliance, Cites China Threat

author: Piotr Skolimowski
description: US Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem urged Poles to vote for the nationalist opposition candidate in Sunday’s presidential election, wading into a tightly-contested campaign that threatens to derail efforts to rebuild the country’s democratic institutions.
title: Trump Ally Wades Into Poland’s Election, Endorsing Nationalist

author: Joe Deaux, Josh Wingrove
description: The US government is poised to receive a so-called golden share in United States Steel Corp. as a condition for approving Nippon Steel Corp.’s proposed acquisition of the American company.
title: US Set to Receive Golden Share as Part of US Steel-Nippon Deal

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump’s administration vowed to expand its probes on college campuses beyond Ivy League institutions to other schools — including the University of California system — as the White House’s targeting of higher education intensifies.
title: University of California Is Next Target of Trump’s Antisemitism Probe

author: Fiona Rutherford
description: Recent cutbacks at the Department of Health and Human Services will hurt, or even reverse, decades of progress in reducing the use of addictive tobacco products, more than 80 public health organizations and advocacy groups warned in a letter to Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: RFK Jr.’s Cuts to Anti-Tobacco Agencies Slammed by Health Groups

author: Nick Wadhams, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio ordered US embassies worldwide to stop scheduling interviews for student visas as the Trump administration weighs stricter vetting of applicants’ social-media profiles.
title: US Orders Halt in Student-Visa Interviews Before New Vetting

author: Jorge Zuloaga
description: Spain’s government decided to conduct its own review of BBVA SA’s bid for rival Banco Sabadell SA, after the country’s antitrust watchdog last month cleared the offer with some conditions.
title: BBVA’s Sabadell Bid Delayed Further as Government Starts Review

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Texas lawmakers voted to require public schools to display the Ten Commandments in every classroom, advancing a conservative priority before the end of the state legislature’s session next week.
title: Texas Lawmakers Require the Ten Commandments in Every Classroom

author: Chris Dolmetsch, Michelle Kaske
description: New York won a temporary freeze on potential Trump administration moves to withhold federal approvals or funds for the state’s transportation projects, as the president tries to end Manhattan’s congestion pricing program.
title: NY Wins Bid to Stop US From Freezing Funds in Congestion Fight

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump warned in a social media post Tuesday that Russian leader Vladimir Putin was “playing with fire”, as the US weighs whether to target Moscow with additional sanctions over its long-range missile and drone barrage against Ukraine.
title: Trump Warns Putin ‘Playing With Fire’ as Lawmakers Eye Sanctions

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. met President Javier Milei in Buenos Aires, signaling renewed Trump administration support for Argentina with the second trip by a US cabinet secretary in recent weeks.
title: Milei Burnishes His Trump Ties by Hosting Health Chief RFK Jr.

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said he intends to lead Canada to “the largest transformation of its economy since the Second World War,” in a speech delivered by King Charles III to open the new parliamentary session.
title: King Charles Delivers Carney's Economic Pledge to Canadian Parliament

author: Chris Anstey, Philip Heijmans
description: Southeast Asian leaders called out unilateral trade actions in a joint statement late Tuesday, without specifically mentioning the US — the region’s largest export customer.
title: Southeast Asia Leaders Make a Veiled Jab at US Tariff Actions

author: Peter Martin
description: Islamist militants in West Africa could develop new revenue streams if they succeed in reaching the coast, the head of the US military’s Africa Command warned Tuesday.
title: West African Coast Could Boost Revenue for Jihadists, US Warns

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump threatened to withhold federal funding from California, accusing Governor Gavin Newsom of failing to comply with an executive order barring transgender people from competing in women’s sports.
title: Trump Threatens California Funding Freeze Over Trans Athletes

author: Satviki Sanjay
description: A successful trade deal with the US could help India mitigate external risks and boost its exports, the South Asian country said, as its government seeks to speed up talks and reach an interim agreement.
title: India Sees US Trade Deal as Key to Lowering External Risks

author: S'thembile Cele, Loni Prinsloo
description: South Africa’s lawmakers challenged a plan to provide an alternative to Black ownership rules that will pave the way for Elon Musk’s Starlink to operate in Africa’s biggest economy.
title: South Africa Lawmakers Slam Starlink Plan Over ‘Back Door’ Entry

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court refused to hear an appeal from a public middle school student who said his free speech rights were violated when his principal barred him from wearing a T-shirt saying “there are only two genders.”
title: Supreme Court Rejects Student Appeal on ‘Two Genders’ Shirt

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he was encouraged the European Union is speeding up negotiations on trade, days after he said the bloc would face 50% tariffs if they fail to reach a deal with the US.
title: Trump Lauds EU for Speeding Tariff Negotiations After Threat

author: S'thembile Cele, Ntando Thukwana
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa laughed off Donald Trump’s Oval Office ambush, in his first direct comments since returning from the encounter with his American counterpart last week.
title: Ramaphosa Recalls His Bemusement at Trump Oval Office Encounter

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s nationalist presidential candidate Karol Nawrocki is fighting off fresh allegations about his past that threaten to damage the boxer-turned-politician days before a tight election.
title: Polish Nationalist Brushes Off Reports About Checkered Past

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is moving to cancel all remaining federal contracts with Harvard University, marking the latest escalation of its battle against the oldest and richest US school.
title: Trump to End Federal Contracts With Harvard University

author: Henry Meyer, Taylan Bilgic
description: Russia supports Turkey hosting another round of peace talks with Ukraine after a first meeting made no progress in US efforts to halt more than three years of war.
title: Russia Backs Turkey for New Ukraine Talks After Nixing Vatican

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India will for the first time allow private firms to design and develop advanced warplanes, as it beefs up domestic defense production to reduce reliance on imports.
title: India Allows Private Firms to Build Advanced Fighter Jets

author: Philip Aldrick
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves must stick to her fiscal rules and keep spending under control or risk a market backlash that undermines the government’s economic plans, the International Monetary Fund warned.
title: IMF Warns UK to Keep Budget in Check or Risk Market Revolt

author: Dan Strumpf
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: India and Pakistan’s Water Wars Are Just Beginning

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s one-time presidential frontrunner, nationalist Calin Georgescu, said he plans to withdraw from politics, potentially weakening the Black Sea nation’s far-right movement.
title: Romania’s Georgescu Exits Politics After Ban, Denting Far Right

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said Ukraine’s allies decided several months ago to drop restrictions on the use of the weapons they’ve provided to allow Kyiv to strike targets deep inside Russia.
title: Merz Says Kyiv’s Allies Ended Curbs on Russia Strikes Months Ago

author: Lucy White
description: Reform UK leader Nigel Farage vowed to scrap a limit on child benefits, vying for traditional Labour voters and putting pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer to reverse his own stance on the controversial policy.
title: Farage Backs Benefit Hikes in Challenge From Starmer’s Left

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber
description: Germany is considering restrictions on military exports to Israel over concerns about civilian suffering in Gaza, a notable shift from one of the country’s biggest weapons suppliers.
title: Germany Weighs Curbs on Israel Arms Exports on Gaza Concerns

author: Josh Xiao, Kok Leong Chan
description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang rallied a group of Southeast Asian and Gulf states to deepen cooperation and touted his country’s economic strength, as Beijing ramps up its charm offensive abroad to counter US efforts to isolate the economy.
title: China Calls on Asean, Gulf States to Create ‘Big Market’

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The European Union and the US signaled a willingness to end a stalemate and work toward a trade deal over the next six weeks, in the first major thaw in their frigid economic relations since President Donald Trump’s second term began in January.
title: US and EU Race for Trade Deal With Six Weeks Left Until Truce Expires

author: Anisah Shukry, Philip Heijmans, Avril Hong
description: The US reducing its proposed tariffs on Malaysia to a 10% baseline would be seen as a positive move, Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Zafrul Aziz said, conceding that a previously hoped for levy of zero may not be possible.
title: Malaysia Sees Reducing the US’s Proposed Tariff to 10% as a Good Outcome

author: Denny Thomas
description: North Korea sharply criticized President Donald Trump’s plan for a Golden Dome missile-defense system, a shield intended to counter threats from rivals including Pyongyang.
title: North Korea Says Trump’s Golden Dome Risks ‘Space Nuclear War’

author: Ishika Mookerjee, Sonikka Loganathan
description: The suspension of a water-sharing agreement in place for 65 years signals a new low in relations between the nations.
title: Why This River in India and Pakistan Is Causing So Much Angst

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice has authorized the federal police to investigate one of the sons of former President Jair Bolsonaro over allegations that he sought to intimidate members of the court while in the US.
title: Bolsonaro’s Son Investigated Over Alleged Court Intimidation

author: Ben Westcott
description: US private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management LP is preparing a bid for the strategically-important Port of Darwin, currently owned by Chinese firm Landbridge Group, The Australian newspaper reported.
title: Cerberus Eyes Chinese Firm’s Darwin Port, the Australian Says
